title.native: 劇場版 ソードアート・オンライン プログレッシブ 星なき夜のアリア
title.romaji: Sword Art Online: Progressive - Hoshinaki Yoru no Aria
title.english: Sword Art Online the Movie -Progressive- Aria of a Starless Night

description:
Return to the death game where it all began—Sword Art Online. In this new Aincrad Arc by original creator Reki Kawahara, the story is seen through Asuna’s eyes. What at first seems like a dream come true quickly becomes a nightmare when newbie gamer Asuna Yuuki learns the only way to escape the virtual world of Aincrad is to beat all 100 levels—but “Game Over” means you die in the real world.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: Sword Art Online: Progressive - อาเรียแห่งคืนที่ไร้ดาว
Sword Art Online Progressive: Ária de Uma Noite Sem Estrelas

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Goblin
tags.description: A goblin is a monstrous creature from European folklore. They are almost always small and grotesque, mischievous or outright malicious, and greedy. Sometimes with magical abilities.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

name.native: アンドリュー・ギルバート・ミルズ

alternative: Johnny Black (ジョニー・ブラック)

node.description:
__Current Residence:__ Nerima, Tokyo, Japan
__Doujin Circle:__ WordGear

Kawahara Reki graduated from the Aoyama Gakuin University.

[Official Website](http://wordgear.sblo.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kunori)

[Official website](http://bunplusbun.sakura.ne.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bunbun922) | [Blog (abec)](http://abec.blog93.fc2.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bunbun_plus) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/8142) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/c/BUNBUN922)

His older sister is [Yukiko Horiguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/102497/Yukiko-Horiguchi).

Major illustration works: 
- Kare Kanojo and Summon Magic (カレとカノジョと召喚魔法)
- Mary Rose (薔薇のマリア) - We AI (僕らA.I) 
- Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonica Black Series (神曲奏界ポリフォニカ ブラック・シリーズ) 
- Girl with Radio Jamming (ラジオガール・ウィズ・ジャミング) 
- Zoahanta (ゾアハンター) (with Junichi Osako, author of Polyphonica Black) 
- Asuka 
- Garouden Mahjon - (アスカ -麻雀餓狼伝-) 
- All Death War (全死大戦)  

Other works: 
- Illustrations BUNBUN (illustration collection) 
- Rondo of Swords (DS game - character designs) 
- Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonia THE BLACK (PC Game / Kinetic Novel - character designs).
Animator and character designer affiliated with A-1 Pictures.
Animator and character designer affiliated with A-1 Pictures.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

Yuki Kajiura was born in Japan but raised in West Germany for most of her childhood. Her father was a big fan of classical and opera music and always desired for Yuki to play the piano for him. Yuki eventually gained a love for music and a love for the piano. Yuki started out as an SE programmer, but changed to music in 1992. She made her grand debut with a female trio called "[See-Saw](https://anilist.co/staff/104342)."  In the years to come the group released six singles and two albums. 

Yuki then went on to work on her solo career composing for artists and some TV, films, and games, such as _Blood: The Last Vampire_ in 2001, and _Xenosaga II_ and _III_. In 2001, Yuki's claim to fame came with the release of the anime [_NOIR_](https://anilist.co/anime/272). The soundtrack sold 50,000 copies. In 2002, she was brought on to project .hack to write the score to [_.hack//SIGN_](https://anilist.co/anime/48), along with vocalist [Chiaki Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101059) and New York singer [Emily Bindiger](https://anilist.co/staff/103845). Shortly after Yuki comprised an album of original and complied songs known as Fiction, working again with Emily Bindiger as well as _Xenosaga_ vocalist Deb Lyons.  

Yuki's other well-known works were for [_Mobile Suite Gundam Seed_](https://anilist.co/anime/93), which hit 5th on the Oricon Charts its first week, and selling over 200,000 copies. Yuki has also become known for her work on CLAMP's [_Tsubasa Chronicle_](https://anilist.co/anime/177) series, [movie](https://anilist.co/anime/807), and [OVAs](https://anilist.co/anime/2685). In 2003, she formed the project [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691) in which pairs Yuki's songwriting and composition with different performing vocalists, first as separate solo works and later into a singular group. In 2007, Yuki formed the band [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975), with two partners from FictionJunction, Wakana Ootaki and [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664), to perform for the anime [_Kara no Kyoukai_](https://anilist.co/anime/2593), further working on several others. Kalafina disbanded in 2018, with their final lineup including Wakana, Keiko, and [Hikaru](https://anilist.co/staff/168857).

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).

[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ayase_0404) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayase_0404/) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/86488427) | [Piapro](https://piapro.jp/Ayase_0404) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvpredjG93ifbCP1Y77JyFA)__

Ayase is a Japanese composer, lyricist, arranger and member of the music duo [YOASOBI](https://anilist.co/staff/194287/YOASOBI).

Twitter __Ryou Eguchi__ is a Japanese producer, composer and arranger. He was the producer of the Japanese rock-band School Food Punishment between 2008 until 2012 when the band officially disbanded. He later joined la la larks, with previous members from the band School Food Punishment as their producer.

[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/renanlon) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RenanAlonsoDub) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/renanlon) | [Youtube 1](https://www.youtube.com/@Renan_Alonso) | [Youtube 2](https://www.youtube.com/@falafaladubdub) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@renanlon)

Renan Alonso is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, musical director, musician, and podcaster. He is married to the voice actress [Bruna Nogueira](https://anilist.co/staff/176954/) and son of [Gilberto de Syllos](https://anilist.co/staff/258936/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Mortimer "Morty" Smith (Rick and Morty franchise and MultiVersus)
- Yoru (Valorant)
- Adrian "Alucard" Tepes (Castlevania and Castlevania: Nocturne)
- Percival de Rolo III (The Legend of Vox Machina)
- Cole Johnson (The Babysitter and The Babysitter: Killer Queen)
- H.U.E. (Final Space)
- Seo Hyun-Woo / Renan (Iris II: New Generation)
- Louis / Kang Ji-Sung (Shopping King Louie)
- Il-Sik (Mr. Sunshine)
- Eduard Zonte (Maggie & Bianca Fashion Friends)
- Happy (Happy!)
- Dirk Gently (Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency)
- Joel Maisel (The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel)
- Ace Spade (Heels)
- Bumblebee (Transformers: Cyberverse)
- Spike Barker (Go, Dog. Go!)
- Min-Gi Park, The Conductor, Cross-Eyed Ducks, Alrick Timmens, Roy and Brando / Zoobee (Infinity Train)
!~
